title: Baseline Fonts News - September 28, 2005
content:
[http://www.baselinefonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329210722/http:/www.baselinefonts.com/)

Baseline Fonts announces the release of several new typefaces this week, including Rough Egyptienne™, Grit Egyptienne™ and Antimony™.

Rough Egyptienne™ is a three-font family including Regular, Italic and Left Oblique. It is nicely worn but highly legible even at small point sizes.

Grit Egyptienne™ is an eight font family designed with heavy grunge in mind. The distressed look is what lead to the formation of Baseline Fonts - but now designers seem to be more willing to really extend even further into worn and nicely throttled type treatments. Grit Egyptienne™ and alternates are interchangeable to provide an endless array of variation in a block or single line of type.

PDF specimen sheet is available for download: [http://www.baselinefonts.com/sample-gritegyptienne.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329210722/http:/www.baselinefonts.com/sample-gritegyptienne.pdf)

Antimony™ is a vertical typeface with delicate, worn flairs and includes a regular version as well as a distressed version.  
PDF specimen sheet is available for download: [http://www.baselinefonts.com/sample-antimony.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329210722/http:/www.baselinefonts.com/sample-antimony.pdf)

Coincidentally, all three new typefaces enable a significant number of characters to be packed into a relatively small footprint.

All fonts are available directly through the Baseline Fonts website ( [www.baselinefonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329210722/http:/www.baselinefonts.com/)) and should be available through all Baseline Fonts vendors over the next few months.
author: paul d hunt : 3 October, 2005 - 6:42am
